sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The US joins calls for more urgent humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip, while France vows to send 700 tonnes of extra aid there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A 12th package of sanctions against Russia has been signed off by the EU almost two years after Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: BP says it'll stop transporting oil and gas through the Red Sea as Yemen's Houthi rebels continue to attack shipping there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: France says it will send 700 tonnes of extra aid to the Gaza Strip as civilians continue to struggle for access to essentials such as food and water.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Human Rights Watch has accused Tel Aviv of war crimes by using civilians' starvation as a war technique.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: For Israeli authorities, the NGO is anti-Semitic and anti-Israeli. The US has joined the voices calling for more urgent humanitarian aid to the Palestinian enclave, but US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin assured in Tel Aviv that his country will continue to support Israel in its military efforts against Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: On the European side, the head of EU diplomacy, Josep Borrell, deplored the distressing lack of discernment in Israeli operations in Gaza and called again for a humanitarian ceasefire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Despite the criticism, civilian casualties in the Gaza Strip continue to rise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Palestinian authorities run by Hamas report more than 19,000 confirmed dead, without distinction between civilians and militants. The number of wounded exceeds 52,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Israeli army assured on Monday that attacks are being aborted to avoid civilian casualties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: According to the same Palestinian source, conditions in southern Gaza and hospitals are catastrophic due to a lack of human and material resources. Israeli troops are accused of detaining the directors and staff of several hospitals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The EU has signed off on a 12th package of sanctions against Russia, almost two years after its full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A ban on Russian diamonds mined, processed and produced in Russia, as well as Russian diamonds processed and produced in other countries, is one of the key provisions, in line with the agreement at the G7.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The more sanctions that are imposed, however, the more difficult it gets to carve out new ones, especially if countries feel their economies are getting hit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I don't think anyone believes that this particular sanction is going to be the one that really swings the war in a particular direction. It's just a question now of keeping adding small bits of additional pressure, which may have a limited economic impact with the hope that it has a long-term impact on the ability of the Russian economy to grow and to technologically transform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The package also focuses on sanctioned circumvention, with the G7 aiming to push hard on enforcement of the price cap on Russian oil at $60 a barrel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: What the 12 package does show is that it is still possible to get consensus amongst the EU27 on sanctions and that shouldn't be underestimated. To do this on 12 separate occasions is no easy thing when we're talking about something that requires complete consensus in order for a package to move forward. However, it is certainly not going to get any easier now. Many member states have really conflicting views on the role of sanctions that it should play in this war. And it is going to be much more difficult in the future to get harmonisation and to get agreement. Russian aluminium products will also be sanctioned for the first time, as well as a prohibition on software designed to hamper agreement. Mary your news Brussels according to the US Treasury sanctions against Russia are

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: working their new data shows the ruble is weaker and locals are leaving the country but with sanctions skepticism growing on both sides of the pond your news asked the US Deputy Secretary of the Treasury what proof he had.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Russia's economy is smaller. Russia has fewer people today and their economy is less flexible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: What Russia is today is a wartime economy. They're trying to produce as many weapons as possible, but they're no longer producing things that are going to strengthen their economy over time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And they're spending out the reserves that they've built over years to buy things like to try and build tanks, but also to buy tankers. While our economies have, we have to admit, suffered because of Russia's war on Ukraine, our economies have been far stronger than Russia's. And because of our alliance, we have the ability to invest in the future to make sure that our people have opportunities that frankly most Russians will never have because of Vladimir Putin's actions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But a major roadblock for the West, making sure sanctions are actually effective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Does the Treasury have any suggestions to overcome loopholes and sanction circumvention?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Circumvention is a challenge. And it's one of the ways we know that our sanctions are working, is that the Kremlin has ordered their intelligence services to design ways to try and get around them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But what we've done, working very closely with the European Union, is design an avenue of going after that circumvention, using our sanctions and export controls.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But we've also went out on joint missions between the United States, the EU, and UK, and went to countries where we're seeing circumvention.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We're making very clear to them, they have a choice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They can either continue to do business with Russia, a small and getting smaller economy in the global sense, or they can do business with us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Another big challenge, getting the green light for more funding for Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At a summit last week in Brussels, the Hungarian government blocked a 50 billion aid package.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Similarly in the US, cash for Ukraine remains in limbo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Just like in our country, it takes time to work through these packages, the same is true in Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: You have to have debates, but ultimately we are aligned from a values perspective and we're committed to continue to support the European people as they help us defend Ukraine and provide Ukraine with the resources they need.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And that's what I expect to happen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As politicians debate, the war drags on in Ukraine with major casualties on both sides. The World Bank says the country will need over 400 billion euros to reconstruct. Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Serbian President Vucic's progressive party celebrated its victory in the parliamentary

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The beaten liberal pro-EU cartel denounced the intimidation of the media and civil rights activists and opponents of the president took to the street claiming the vote was rigged.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: International election observers weren't able to confirm a systematic electoral rigging by the government, but they seem to agree with the complaints of the opposition. Any efforts to tilt the playing field is a cause for concern and could potentially impact the outcome. And I think we have been very clear in our report about that there was not really a playing feat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They also confirmed other pre-electoral manipulations denounced by the opposition last night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They say they have witnessed irregularities such as stuffing of ballot boxes, great crowds, group voting and also problems with the secrecy of voting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: What they also mention is the massive coming of people from outside of Belgrade to vote in Belgrade, people who are not from Belgrade or from Serbia as well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The final report of the OSCE will be published in two months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Yet the alleged frauds could only have been decisive in the municipal election of Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The rest of Serbia voted for the ruling party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The opposition claims that their defeat is due to the omnipresence of President Vucic in the Serbian media and intimidation against civil servants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: against civil servants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Energy giant BP says it'll stop transporting oil and gas through the Red Sea as attacks on commercial vessels by Yemen's Houthi rebels continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They've targeted Israeli-linked vessels during the war in Gaza and have escalated their attacks in the last few days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Brigadier General Yahya Sari, the Houthi military spokesman, said on Monday they launched what he described as a naval aircraft at the Swan Atlantic, a chemical and oil products carrier and the MSC Clara cargo ship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Some of the world's top shipping companies and oil giants have now been scared off, meaning that a key route that 10 per cent of global trade passes through is now almost completely out of use.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ships will now have to go around the Cape of Good Hope at the bottom of Africa instead, adding around 10 days or longer to their journeys.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And that means the price of food and many other goods will inevitably rise. The European Union is investigating the social media platform X over possible breaches of

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: social media law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's the first time that the European Commission launches an infringement procedure under its Digital Services Act.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The legislation was approved to create a safer digital space where the fundamental rights of users are protected and to establish a level playing field for businesses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The opening of proceedings means that the Commission will now investigate X's systems and policies related to certain suspected infringements. It is not to judge the outcome of the investigation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The decision was announced on the social media platform itself by Thierry Breton, the Commissioner in charge of the EU'sU.'s internal market.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The investigation will look into whether X, formerly known as Twitter, failed to do enough to curb the spread of illegal content, and also whether measures to combat information manipulation were effective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The E.U. will also examine whether X was transparent enough on the matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The European Commission has already called out Elon Musk, ex-owner, to do more towards eliminating hate speech, misinformation and violent terrorist content related to the war between Israel and Hamas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: German farmers drove their tractors to Berlin's Brandenburg Gate on Monday after hearing that they would no longer receive a tax break for using diesel. Das ist eine Katastrophe, weil bei den Betrieben, zum Beispiel bei Kleinbetrieben, gehen pro Betrieb ca. schon mal 5000 Euro raus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 5000 Euro, die sie mehr bezahlen müssen am Ende.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Und das tut schon weh, gerade bei der jetzigen Ertragslage, die wir haben, plus diesen zusätzlich hohen Kostensteigerungen, die wir die letzten Jahre mitmachen mussten, ist das schon sehr katastrophal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Überraschend, dass der deutsche Landwirtschaftsminister mit den Landwirten zusammengearbeitet hat, weil sie keine Alternative haben, nur Diesel zu nutzen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In der Zwischenzeit schreibt das Regierung auch eine Fahrtax-Exemption für Landwirte. Die Konsequenz ist, nicht nur für uns, sondern für die kompletten Verbraucher, die Lebensmittel werden teurer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Die Landwirte sagen, dass ihre schwere Maschine nur auf Diesel fahren kann und es noch nicht möglich ist, elektrisch zu schalten.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Die Landwirte-Assoziation sagt, dass der Landwirtschaftssektor fast 1 Billion Euro verlieren könnte.
